kiwi.ui
Class UIElementChooser

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  kiwi.ui.KPanel
                      kiwi.ui.UIElementChooser
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class UIElementChooser
extends KPanel

A chooser component for UIElements. The component consists of a scrollable list box to the right of a display area which is used to display the currently-selected element.

Author:
Mark Lindner, PING Software Group
See Also:
Serialized Form

Construct a new UIElementChooser with the specified viewer and element list.

Parameters:
viewer - A viewer component for displaying the element.
list - A Vector of elements that can be picked from.

getSelectedItem

public UIElement getSelectedItem()
Get the currently selected item.

Returns:
The currently selected UIElement, or null if there is no selection.

setSelectedItem

public void setSelectedItem(UIElement element)
Set the currently selected item.

Parameters:
element - The UIElement to select.

setSelectedItem

public void setSelectedItem(java.lang.String name)
Set the currently selected item by name.

Parameters:
name - The name of the element to select; the name of each UIElement in the list is compared to the specified name; if the names match, the corresponding item in the list is selected.
See Also:
UIElement.getName()
